result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marla M. Rice

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on November 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
10/4/22  hearing rescheduled by Court to 11/18 930am. NTBS.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Schwarz.   Clerk HMcBride.   Adjmt granted for further investigation.  FPT 10/4 1:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom  w/ Attorney Schwarz.  Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Schwarz requests adjmt for reasons stated on the record. Granted.  FPT 8/25 @ 845am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Schwarz.   Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Schwarz requests adjmt to review discovery. Granted. PTC 8/1 2:30pm. Bond continued.

Defendant Marla M. Rice appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Drew Lehman appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:16 PM   State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.   Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwartz.   Clerk JT  Minutes: Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am. Bond continued w/ same conditions (see previous bond entry). mi

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marla M. Rice in court, in custody.  Attorney Alexander Huber appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  William S.

145PM    Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Joseph Corcoran.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on April 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.  $2500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  ts
